page.title: 04Green End Farm
page.content:
We interviewed David Green a Great Barford farmer. Life on the farm has changed a lot in the last 50 years. Now only one man is needed to do the work instead of four. It is mainly an arable farm of about 100 acres.Growing this year are 58 acres of Galahad winter wheat.This will be sold either for biscuit making or animal feed.There are 15 acres of Avalon winter wheat which will be sold for bread making.He has 9 acres of spring barley which will be used for malting beer. He also grows peas, potatoes,broccoli,winter cabbage and grass.The grain and peas are harvested in August.In September the ground is cultivated or ploughed ready for the next crop of wheat to be drilled in October.
s .
